ext.description: To replace the matching content, you can use the js statement
ext.config.title: jsReplace setting
ext.config.commands.items.name: Replace command
ext.config.commands.items.match: A regular expression used to match literals
ext.config.commands.items.replace: The matched text, $1 represents the first grouping content matched, and $_ represents the matched substring
ext.config.setting: Replace settings, configure variable name mappings for more parameters and $1 to $n prefix customization
ext.config.setting.prefix: If the prefix matches the grouping variable, set to $, the variable is $1 to $n
ext.config.setting.actionLanguages: Register the command with the code action
ext.config.setting.actionIgnoreCommands: For commands that need to be ignored in code action, fill in the "name" field in jsReplace.commands
ext.config.setting.actionNameFormat: Code action formatting, $name represents the command's name, $description represents the command's description
transform.match.input.title: Enter a regular expression that matches the text
transform.match.input.prompt: You do not need to add /, for example: [0-9]+ stands for /[0-9]+/g
transform.replace.input.title: Enter a js expression to replace the text
getReplaceText.required: Please enter the js expression for the substitution
